title: What push-to-talk key do you use for voice chat?
body:
Hey folks!

I'm a UX designer working on League's voice chat (here's our [old announcement](https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/en-us/2017/12/dev-upcoming-party-changes/) if you want to check it out)  and wanted to get your input on push-to-talk. If you have time to answer a couple short questions, it'll help us a ton. For all you PTT enthusiasts out there...

* What PTT key do you typically use in other games to broadcast? What would you use in League?
* Would you change any other keys you typically use to make room for your preferred PTT key? If so, which ones?

Thanks for your help!

**EDIT:** Also to clarify: you'll be able to change the key. We're interested for thinking about defaults and looking at overlap with keys that already have jobs (which we don't want to take away, it's a rough world out there).

**EDIT:** And for those who aren't PTT fans, voice activation will be an option. As long as you close your mouth when you breathe.

**EDIT:** Hey all! Thank you so much for all the info and taking the time to respond! This will be incredibly helpful for us.

I use the squiggly key (tilde key). It's out of the way while simultaneously being very easily accessible , and to top it off it's almost never used, so there's no accidental pushing while typing, etc. Imo, I don't believe there's a better PTT button on the entire keyboard.

I wouldn't change other keys because generally speaking, I don't have to. It's a key that's really never used.

But if I had to go back to using a button, especially for league, I think something like left control or left alt might be good options.  Something accessible by pinky or thumb, as those two fingers have slightly less to do with using abilities.
